column1: 1 ^ Sáĕpe expugnavérunt me ab juventúte mea
column2: dicat nunc Isráhel. ^ Often have they fought against me from my youth

column1: 2 ^ Sáĕpe expugnavérunt me ab juventúte mea~; ètenim non potuérunt mìhi. ^ Often have they fought against me from my youth
column2: but they could not prevail over me.

column1: 3 ^ Supra dorsum meum fabricavérunt peccatóres~; prolongavérunt iniqŭitátem suam. ^ The wicked have wrought upon my back~; they have lengthened their iniquity.
4 ^ Dòminus justus concáĕdet cervíces peccatórum. ^ The Lord who is just will cut the necks of sinners.
5 ^ Confundántur et convertántur retrórsum òmnes qŭi odérunt Siónem. ^ Let them all be confounded and turned back that hate Sion.

column3: ^ Let them be as grass upon the tops of houses
column4: which withereth before it be plucked up

column1: 7 ^ de qŭo non implévit manum suam qŭi mètit
column2: et sinum suum qŭi manìpulos còlliǧit. ^ who with the mower filleth not his hand
column3: nor he that gathereth sheaves his bosom.

column2: «~Benedìcțio Dòmini super vos~; benedíximus vobîs in nómine Dòmini.~»^ And they that passed by have not said
column3: "The blessing of the Lord be upon you~; we have blessed you in the name of the Lord."
